page.title: 01HOOK NORTON/INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block contains two villages, the larger Hook Norton(pop.1700) in the NE corner and Great Rollright (pop. 520)in the SW corner. In between is prime agricultural land, intersected with B class roads. Hook Norton has a whole range of services available, echoing the self-sufficiency of l00 years ago. Small businesses provide some work but many commute to Oxford/Stratford/London It is a lively community with clubs/ societies/evening classes etc. Aesthetically the village is striking, with a wealth of old houses(many still thatched) built of local earthy-colour ironstone arranged chaotically with new houses in-filling and estates on the village edges. The local history is imprinted on the landscape in names of houses(Bedlam),streets(Netting Street, Tyte Lane). The SE edge is dominated by the empty pillars of the old viaducts.
